slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचऊर्ध्वमूलमध:शाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् ।छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: “Lord Shri Krishna continued: This phenomenal creation, which is both ephemeral and eternal, is like a tree, but having its seed above in the Highest and its ramifications on this earth below. The scriptures are its leaves, and he who understands this, knows.

slokas: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखागुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवाला: ।अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानिकर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Its branches shoot upwards and downwards, deriving their nourishment from the Qualities; its buds are the objects of sense; and its roots, which follow the Law causing man’s regeneration and degeneration, pierce downwards into the soil.

slokas: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यतेनान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा ।अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूल-मसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: In this world its true form is not known, neither its origin nor its end, and its strength is not understood., until the tree with its roots striking deep into the earth is hewn down by the sharp axe of non-attachment.

slokas: तत: पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यंयस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूय: ।तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्येयत: प्रवृत्ति: प्रसृता पुराणी ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Beyond lies the Path, from which, when found, there is no return. This is the Primal God from where this ancient creation has sprung.

slokas: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषाअध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामा: ।द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ता: सुखदु:खसंज्ञै-र्गच्छन्त्यमूढा: पदमव्ययं तत् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: The wise attain Eternity when, freed from pride and delusion, they have conquered their love for the things of sense; when, renouncing desire and fixing their gaze on the Self, they have ceased to be tossed to and fro by the opposing sensations, like pleasure and pain.

slokas: न तद्भ‍ासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावक: ।यद्ग‍त्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Neither sun, moon, nor fire shines there. Those who go towards that place never come back. For, O Arjuna, that is my Celestial Home!

slokas: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूत: सनातन: ।मन:षष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: It is only a very small part of My Eternal Self, which is the life of the universe, drawing round itself the six senses, the mind the last, which have their source in Nature.

slokas: शरीरं यदवाप्‍नोति यच्च‍ाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वर: ।गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: When the Supreme Lord enters a body or leaves it, He gathers these senses together and travels on with them, as the wind gathers perfume while passing through the flowers.

slokas: श्रोत्रं चक्षु: स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च ।अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: He is the perception of the ear, the eye, the touch, the taste and the smell, yea and of the mind also; and the enjoyment the things which they perceive is also His.

slokas: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वाऽपि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् ।विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुष: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: The ignorant do not see that it is He Who is present in life and Who departs at death or even that it is He Who enjoys pleasure through the Qualities. Only the eye of wisdom sees.

slokas: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ।यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतस: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: The saints with great effort find Him within themselves; but not the unintelligent, who in spite of every effort cannot control their minds.

slokas: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भ‍ासयतेऽखिलम् ।यच्च‍न्द्रमसि यच्च‍ाग्न‍ौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Remember that the Light which, proceeding from the sun, illumines the whole world, and the Light which is in the moon, and That which is in the fire also, all are born of Me.

slokas: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा ।पुष्णामि चौषधी: सर्वा: सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मक: ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: I enter this world and animate all My creatures with My vitality; and by My cool moonbeams I nourish the plants.

slokas: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रित: ।प्राणापानसमायुक्त: पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Becoming the fire of life, I pass into their bodies and, uniting with the vital streams of Prana and Apana, I digest the various kinds of food.

slokas: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टोमत्त: स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च ।वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्योवेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: I am enthroned in the hearts of all; memory, wisdom and discrimination owe their origins to Me. I am He Who is to be realised in the scriptures; I inspire their wisdom and I know their truth.

slokas: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च ।क्षर: सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: There are two aspects in Nature: the perishable and the imperishable. All life in this world belongs to the former, the unchanging element belongs to the latter.

slokas: उत्तम: पुरुषस्त्वन्य: परमात्मेत्युदाहृत: ।यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वर: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: But higher than all am I, the Supreme God, the Absolute Self, the Eternal Lord, Who pervades the worlds and upholds them all.

slokas: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तम: ।अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथित: पुरुषोत्तम: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Beyond comparison of the Eternal with the non-eternal am I, Who am called by scriptures and sages the Supreme Personality, the Highest God.

slokas: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् ।स सर्वविद्भ‍जति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: He who with unclouded vision sees Me as the Lord-God, knows all there is to be known, and always shall worship Me with his whole heart.

slokas: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ ।एतद्‍बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Thus, O Sinless One, I have revealed to you this most mystic knowledge. He who understands gains wisdom and attains the consummation of life.”
